tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: “The distinguisher” is the literal translation of ‘al-furqan’, which is the criterion for distinguishing between truth and falsehood. God is all knowing and all aware and also the Absolute Sovereign
distractors: This verse explains the rules of inheritance

This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: What key concept does this verse highlight?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Those who denied the truth used to denigrate the Quran as a false testament, but in fact the target of their allegation was the Prophet Muhammad. They were unable to understand how an ordinary man could be the possessor of an extraordinary Book
distractors: This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
This verse promises paradise to the righteous
This verse narrates a historical event

tafsirQuiz.question: Which important teaching is conveyed in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Every preacher giving the call for Truth has had to face the same experience, as that of a Prophet. This is so because during his lifetime, a prophet lives the life of an ordinary human being and his contemporaries therefore fail to appreciate the wisdom he propagates
distractors: This verse warns about the punishment of disbelievers
This verse promises paradise to the righteous

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The opponents of Truth frequently make the character of the preacher of Truth their target. The matter of Truth and untruth is important because they will be examined on this basis in the life hereafter
distractors: This verse discusses the creation of the universe

tafsirQuiz.question: What key concept does this verse highlight?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The prophets sent to them had brought to them the message of worshipping one God alone. tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: One of the reasons for this is that people of later ages always devise, of their own accord, legendary accounts of their past prophets with a view to glorifying them

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The moment Truth shows itself by the appearance of God and His angels, it will be the time for reckoning and judgement, and not the time for acceptance
distractors: This verse describes the characteristics of believers

tafsirQuiz.question: What warning or glad tiding is mentioned in Surah Al-Furqan, Ayah 25?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: On the Day of Judgement, those who, taken in by the assertions of false leaders, and not having co-operated with the preacher of Truth, will clearly see that the arguments of their leaders had no real basis in fact

This verse talks about the stories of previous prophets

tafsirQuiz.question: Which important teaching is conveyed in this ayah?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Every objection against such activity—which is based on perfect Truth—is a false one. When the Quran was revealed, it was not revealed all at once, but part by part over a period of 23 years

tafsirQuiz.question: What does this verse warn or promise?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The most important thing required of a man is that he should learn lessons from events, but this is exactly what he fails to do. The names of many of the prophets to whom the Quran refers again and again do not find a place in the recorded history of humanity

tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: The response of those who fail to accept the truth shows that the reason for their being steadfast in their faith, was their prejudice and not the force of any argument

tafsirQuiz.question: What is the central theme of this ayah?

tafsirQuiz.question: What is the main message of Surah Al-Furqan, Ayah 44?
tafsirQuiz.correctAnswer: Animals do not act as a result of thinking, but simply submit to the pressure of their natural instincts. Responding to the lure of desire, a man descends to the level of an animal

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?

tafsirQuiz.question: What insight does the explanation provide about this ayah?

tafsirQuiz.question: What consequence is described in this ayah?
